definition: to be full of praise (idiom)
variant of 贊|赞[zan4]
variant of 贊|赞[zan4]/to praise
to patronize/to support/to praise/(Internet slang) to like (an online post on Facebook etc)
variant of 讚|赞[zan4]
to sigh/to exclaim
variant of 嘆|叹[tan4]
(negative prefix)/not/no
already/to stop/then/afterwards

sentences.chinese: 金碧辉煌的宫殿使她赞叹不已。

sentences.english: The beautiful silks and velvets surprised him very much.
sentences.chinese: 漂亮的丝绸及天鹅绒令他赞叹不已。

sentences.english: Her handling of the crisis fills me _with__admiration_.
sentences.chinese: 她对这一危机的处理使我赞叹不已。

sentences.english: Inside "Buddha Chuan mural, " What is even more amazed.
sentences.chinese: 殿内“佛传壁画”，更令人赞叹不已。

sentences.english: It was just one glance, but its beauty stole my breath away.
sentences.chinese: 我只不过瞥了一眼，但是它的美却令我赞叹不已。

sentences.english: We all admire her for her free-flowing movement.
sentences.chinese: 我们对她流畅的动作赞叹不已。

sentences.english: He dazzled the crowd with his oratory skills.
sentences.chinese: 他以演讲术使听众赞叹不已。

sentences.english: Passersby speak highly of the distinctive design of the new stadium.
sentences.chinese: 路人对新体育场的独特设计赞叹不已。

sentences.english: The daring exploits of the parachutists were much admired.
sentences.chinese: 跳伞者大胆的冒险动作令人赞叹不已。

sentences.english: Take the door, I believe you can are opposite certainly such housetop design praises greatly.
sentences.chinese: 进门，我相信你一定会对这样的屋顶设计赞叹不已。
她的风趣令观众赞叹不已。

sentences.english: We were moved with admiration at the magnificent bridge.
sentences.chinese: 对这座雄伟的大桥，我们感动得赞叹不已。

sentences.english: Tirion could only marvel at the weapon's exceptional craftsmanship and beauty.
sentences.chinese: 提里奥对于这种巧夺天工的手艺只能赞叹不已。

sentences.english: During the banquet, the guests of the Nepalese people love the cuisine, stunning sound.
sentences.chinese: 席间，客人对爱尼人家的菜肴，声声赞叹不已。

sentences.english: They are well-known even abroad and much appreciated by foreign guests.
sentences.chinese: 即使在国外，它们也很出名，很多外国游客赞叹不已。

definition: to click one's tongue in wonder (idiom)/to be astonished
to exclaim in astonishment
(idiom) to gasp in amazement/to acclaim as the peak of perfection
to exclaim in admiration
(to gasp) with admiration
to exclaim in admiration/a gasp of surprise
to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
to praise without cease (idiom); praise sb to high heaven
lit. slap the table and shout with praise (idiom); fig. wonderful!/amazing!/great!
to consider oneself as being not as good as the others
to admire greatly
to feel deep veneration for sb (idiom)
one's thoughts fly to a longed-for place or person/to long for/infatuated/fascinated
to have a whole new level of respect for sb or sth/to sit up and take notice (of sb's improved performance etc)
to convince/to subdue/to be convinced/to be bowled over
lit. as if drunk and stupefied (idiom)/fig. intoxicated by sth/obsessed with/mad about sth
ashamed of being inferior (idiom)/to feel inferior to others
